Title: Lot 2 - Telecare and Telehealth Managed Services
Description: This invitation to tender has been issued by Nottinghamshire County Council as a further competition under Lot 2 of the ESPO framework 203_15 Telecare & Telehealth Products and Services. The tender exercise is limited to those framework suppliers that have indicated in their scope of service that they are able to provide the products and services required in this specific instance. The Adult Social Care & Health department requires an assistive technology service for vulnerable adults with assessed long term social care needs, and adults where it has been assessed that there is a significant risk that long term social care services will be required within the next 12 months if assistive technology (AT) is not provided.

Title: Purchase of PNC 7 for Lifeline service
Description: Charnwood Borough Council is seeking to purchase an upgrade to its current PNC equipment. The PNC equipment is used to answer alarm calls from equipment installed in CBC's sheltered housing stock and Lifeline equipment installed in owner occupiers' homes. The current PNC5 equipment was purchased in 2007. The lifetime contract value is £106,974.00 which includes the initial upgraded equipment cost and annual maintenance cost for years 2 -5.

Title: Provision of Telecare and Teleheath Products and Services for patients with a diagnosis of Heart Failure
Description:
Provision to monitor patients across Derbyshire with a diagnosis of Heart Failure. This is part of an integrated response by DCHS to the increasing number of individuals with chronic diseases and the need to identify innovative and effective ways to meet their clinical needs. This service will be seen as an enabler to the overall aim of introducing strategies to promote self-care and self-management and to support primary care and community teams to effectively monitor patients at risk of exacerbations and hospital admission. It will also support the provision of high quality clinical care and accurate reporting within the Heart Failure Team. 
Mini competition conducted under ESPO / Pro5 Framework Agreement 201 for Telecare and Telehealth Managed Services
for 12 months with option to extend 2 x 12 months if funding permits
